required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Research on the Effect of Different Extents of Internal Limiting Membrane Peeling on Macular Hole Closure and Visual Acuity
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Research on the Effect of Different Extents of Internal Limiting Membrane Peeling on Macular Hole Closure and Visual Acuity

brief_summary.textblock: Observing and describing the surgical effects of different extents of internal limiting membrane peeling combined with internal limiting membrane insertion for macular hole

primary_outcome.measure: Condition of postoperative healing of macular holes
primary_outcome.description: postoperative photograph of macular retina scanned by Angiography Optical Coherence Tomography(AngioOCT)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in best-corrected visual acuity (BCVA)
change from baseline in foveal avascular zone (FAZ) areas and diameter
change from baseline in the area and diameter of deteriorated circulation zone in superficial and deep retina vessels

arm_group.description: Extent of ILM peeling is 4DD and the ILM flap is inserted
Extent of ILM peeling is 2DD and the ILM flap is inserted

intervention.description: The extent of ILM peeling is 4DD
The extent of ILM peeling is 2DD

overall_official.affiliation: The Eye Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University
